content:
For Loops are critical tools in programming that allow you to repeat blocks of code for a specified duration. You can have a block of code repeat X number of times or repeat until a specified condition is met. The `for` loop syntax has **3 key components:**
- `initialExpression:` this part of the loop syntax initializes and/or declares the variable that will be used to determine how many times the loop is executed. the `initialExpression` part of the syntax is only executed once.
- `testExpression:` this is the condition you are operating with (similar to an if statement condition). if the condition in the `testExpression` evaluates to true, the body of the `for` loop will execute. 
- `updateExpression:` this part of the expression updates the variable initialized in the `initialExpression`. The `testExpression` is then evaluated again to see if the condition is still true with this updated value of the variable.
name: For Loops
